definition: name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Duck-foot Health and the Yangtze River, were really the match.
sentences.chinese: 鸭脚生江南，名实本相符。

sentences.english: Carrying on a research to it, we must investigate the name and the material object together, and clarify the source and course.
sentences.chinese: 对之进行研究，必须名实同步考察，源流一并弄清。

sentences.english: I was surprised that he gave his real name to a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 他向陌生人吐露真名实姓，使我感到很吃惊。

sentences.english: In the old acquaintance-society, the term"mediation"is not in consistent with its essence.
sentences.chinese: 在熟人社会，调解是名实分离的。

sentences.english: The debate on linguistics before Qin Dynasty began with the concept on existence and consciousness in philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 先秦语言学的讨论是从哲学上的名实之辩兴起的。

sentences.english: Flash still has no equal to its interactivity.
sentences.chinese: Flash还是没有在交互性上名实相符。

sentences.english: Zhuhai Mingshi Ceramics Valve Co. , Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 珠海市名实陶瓷阀有限公司。

sentences.english: Underwriting must once again deserve the name.
sentences.chinese: 保险业必须重新名实相符。

definition: the whole course of an event from beginning to end/ins and outs/the fundamental and the incidental
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
